model

Interface Unifiable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PCExpression
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Constant, SimpleSentence, Variable

    public interface Unifiable
extends PCExpression
    This interface represents a subdivision among the predicate expressions. It extends the PCExpression interface and creates the subdivision of the predicate expressions that can be unified.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getName()
      Gets the name of the expression.
      SubstitutionSet unify(Unifiable expr, SubstitutionSet s)
      Unifies the expression with the specified expr expression given the bindings s.

      • Methods inherited from interface model.PCExpression

        replaceVariables, standardizeVariablesApart

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of the expression.
        Returns:
        the name of the expression. It will return null if there is no one.

      • unify

        SubstitutionSet unify(Unifiable expr,
                    SubstitutionSet s)
        Unifies the expression with the specified expr expression given the bindings s. This tries to get or add bindings in order to make logically equivalent the expression and the specified expression.

        This method is recursive over all Unifiable implementations.

        Parameters:
        expr - an expression to unify with the expression.
        s - the SubstitutionSet object representing the bindings so far and/or the constraints applied.
        Returns:
        a SubstitutionSet object that contains all the bindings needed to unify the expression to the specified expression.
        See Also:
        SubstitutionSet
